document.docAuthor: Ng, Peter K. L. & Shih, Hsi-Te
document.masterDocTitle: The land crabs of the Discoplax longipes A. Milne-Edwards, 1867 species group, with description of a new species from Guam (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Gecarcinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The land crabs of the Discoplax longipes A. Milne-Edwards, 1867 species group, with description of a new species from Guam (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Gecarcinidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Discoplax aff. longipes
—
Takeda 2000
: 62
, fig. 1 B (Bohol, Philippines ).

Discoplax gracilipes
Ng & Guinot, 2001
: 324
, figs. 9 –11, 12B, 14–16 (Bohol, Philippines ); Ng et al. 2008 : 214 (list);
Husana et al. 2010
: 55
(Samar, Philippines );
Bucol & Alcala 2013
: 64
, fig. 4 (Siquijor, Philippines ); Shih 2013 : 26 , fig. 6 (no new locality).

Remarks .
Ng & Guinot ( 2001 )
discussed the differences between
D. longipes
and
D. gracilipes
at length so there is no need to repeat their treatment here. Although at the time of this paper the specimens from Guam were treated as conspecific with
D. longipes
(and not as a separate species), they do not affect Ng & Guinot’s ( 2001 ) discussion substantially. The major differences are ( 1 ) the meso- and metagastric regions of the carapace are punctate with scattered granules in
D. gracilipes
(distinctly granular in
D. longipes
and
D. michalis
n. sp.
); ( 2 ) the outer surfaces of the ambulatory merus, carpus, and propodus are gently rugose in
D. gracilipes
(distinctly granular and/or lined with strong striae in
D. longipes
and
D. michalis
n. sp.
); ( 3 ) the outer surface of the chela is punctate to granular in
D. gracilipes
(distinctly granular in
D. longipes
and
D. michalis
n. sp.
); ( 4 ) the ambulatory legs of
D. gracilipes
are on average 1.3–1.5 times longer than the equivalent leg of
D. longipes
of a similar size; and ( 5 ) the G 1 of
D. gracilipes
has the outer margin meets the distal part in a gentle curve, with the distal pectinated part relatively longer and directed more obliquely outwards (ca. 80 ° from the vertical) (the G 1 outer margin joins the distal part more abruptly, forming a gentle shelf, with the distal pectinated part relatively shorter and directed ca. 90 ° from the vertical in
D. longipes
and
D. michalis
n. sp.
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Discoplax longipes A. Milne-Edwards, 1867
, anterior thoracic sternums and abdomens. A, male (37.2 × 32.7 mm) (MNHN–B24815), Loyalty Islands; B, male (37.2 × 33.9 mm) (MNHN–B27949), Loyalty Islands; C, male (43.3 × 37.7 mm) (ZRC 2001.1150); D, male (58.9 × 51.1 mm) (MNHN–B28463), Loyalty Islands; E, male (71.9 × 61.7 mm) (MNHN–B20150), Loyalty Islands; F, male (68.2 × 57.4 mm) (ZRC 2002.0050), Loyalty Islands; G, male (68.9 × 61.3 mm) (SMF 4293), Makatea, French Polynesia; H, male (65.0 × 55.7 mm) (SMF 5849), Makatea, French Polynesia; I, male (57.0 × 50.2 mm) (SMF 6680), Niue; J, male (54.0 × 47.0 mm) (SMF 6680), Niue.

FIGURE 9.
Discoplax michalis
n. sp.
A, C, paratype male (68.3 × 60.0 mm) (ZRC 2000.0571), Guam; B, paratype male (41.8 × 36.0 mm) (ZRC 2001.0701), Guam; D, paratype male (69.7 × 57.8 mm) (ZRC 2000.5072), Guam.

FIGURE 10.
Discoplax
species, ambulatory legs. A–F, right second ambulatory legs; G–L, left fourth ambulatory legs. A, G,
D. longipes
A. Milne-Edwards
, 1867
, male (68.2 × 57.4 mm) (ZRC 2002.0050), Loyalty Islands; B, H,
D. longipes
A. Milne- Edwards, 1867, male (43.3 × 37.7 mm) (ZRC 2001.1150), Loyalty Islands; C, I,
D. longipes
A. Milne-Edwards
, 1867
, male (65.0 × 55.7 mm) (SMF 5849), Makatea, French Polynesia; D, J,
D. longipes
A. Milne-Edwards
, 1867
, male (54.0 × 47.0 mm) (SMF 6680), Niue (laterally transposed to facilitate comparisons); E, K,
D. michalis
n. sp.
, paratype male (68.3 × 60.0 mm) (ZRC 2000.0571), Guam; F, L,
D. michalis
n. sp.
, paratype male (41.8 × 36.0 mm) (ZRC 2001.0701), Guam.

FIGURE 11.
Discoplax longipes
A. Milne-Edwards
, 1867
. A, anterior thoracic sternums, sternoabdominal cavities and G1s, male (58.9 × 51.1 mm) (MNHN–B28463), Loyalty Islands; B, sternoabdominal cavity and G1s, male (71.9 × 61.7 mm) (MNHN–B20150), Loyalty Islands; C, D, left G1 (basal part broken off), holotype male (54.6 × 48.5 mm) (MNHN–B3763 S), “New Caledonia”. C, ventral view; D, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution . Bohol, Siquijor, and Samar, all in Philippines .
